1.text: O Unwise Galatians, who has cast a spell upon you, not to obey the truth, to whom before the eyes Jesus Christ was written beforehand, crucified in you?

2.text: This only wish I to learn from you, Received ye the Spirit from the works of the law, or from the hearing of faith?

3.text: Are ye so unwise? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now completed in the flesh?

4.text: Suffered ye so many things in vain? if yet also in vain.

5.text: He therefore furnishing you the Spirit, and working the powers in you, is it from the works of the law, or from the hearing of faith?

6.text: As Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him for justice.

7.text: Know ye therefore that they of faith, these are sons of Abraham.

8.text: And the writing, foreseeing that of faith God justifies the nations, announced beforehand the good news to Abraham, That in thee shall all nations be praised.

9.text: So that they of faith are praised with faithful Abraham.

10.text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it has been written, Cursed every one who remains not in all written in the book of the law to do them.

11.text: And that none is justified in the law before God, is manifest: for, The just shall live of faith.

12.text: And the law is not of faith: but, The man having done them shall live in them.

13.text: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, having been a curse for us: for it has been written, Cursed every one hanging upon a tree:

14.text: That the praise of Abraham might be to the nations in Christ Jesus; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

15.text: Brethren, I speak according to man; Although a man’s covenant, having been confirmed, none annuls, or orders an addition.

16.text: And to Abraham were the promises spoken, and to his seed. He says not, And to seeds, as to many; but as to one: And to thy seed, who is Christ.

17.text: And I say this, the covenant confirmed before by God in Christ, the law, having been after four hundred and thirty years, does not annul, to neglect the promise.

18.text: For if of the law the inheritance, no more of promise: and God has favored Abraham by promise.

19.text: What then the law? It was added on account of transgressions, (till the seed come to whom it was promised;) appointed by angels in the hand of a mediator.

20.text: And a mediator is not of one, and God is one.

21.text: The law then against the promises of God? It may not be: for if a law had been given able to make alive, truly justice would be by the law.

22.text: But the writing shut up all things under sin, that the promise from faith of Jesus Christ might be given to the believing.

23.text: And before faith came, we were guarded under the law, shut up to faith about to be revealed.

24.text: So that the law was our preceptor towards Christ, that we might be justified from faith.

25.text: And faith having come, we are no more under a preceptor.

26.text: For we are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.

27.text: For as many of you as were immersed into Christ have put on Christ.

28.text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither servant nor free, there is neither male and female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.

29.text: And if ye of Christ, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
